The slides (in German) to his talk in our seminar on 30.10.2006 can be found on
www-groups.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/~neunhoef/Publications/talks.html.
He, www.math.rwth-aachen.de/~Frank.Luebeck/Frank Lübeck, and
www.math.rwth-aachen.de/~Thomas.Breuer/ Thomas Breuer patiently answered trillions of specific questions I was too lazy to look up in the excellent www.gap-system.org/Doc/manuals.html. Without their continuous help and advise, not only this package, but the whole &homalg; project would have remained on my todo list.
A lot of ideas that make up this package and the whole &homalg; project came out of intensive discussions with Daniel Robertz during our early collaboration, where we developed our philosophy for a meta package for homological algebra and implemented it in &Maple;.
In the fall of 2007 I began collaborating with Simon Görtzen to further pursue and extend these ideas preparing the transition to &GAP4;. With his help &homalg; became an extendable multi-package project.
